refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds maximum values in an input

refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: [val ind] = cvMaximum(image); val = cvMaximum(image); (only when IndexOutputPort is false) ind = cvMaximum(image); (only when ValueOutputPort is false) [val ind] = cvMaximum(image, name, value,...); val = cvMaximum(image, name, value, ...); (only when IndexOutputPort is false) ind = cvMaximum(image, name, value, ...); (only when ValueOutputPort is false) [val ind] = cvMaximum(image, name, value,c,r); (only when ROI Processing is true) val = cvMaximum(image, name, value,c,r); (only when ROI Processing is true and IndexOutputPort is false) ind = cvMaximum(image, name, value,c,r); (only when ROI Processing is true and ValueOutputPort is false)

listitem.para: This property is set to true to output the maximum value. Default : true.
This property is set to true to output the index of the maximum value. Default : true.
Dimension along which the function operates - Row, Column, All or Custom. Default : All

The integer dimension over which the function calculates the maximum. This value cannot exceed the number of dimensions in input. It applies only when 'Dimension' property is set to 'Custom'. Default : 1
It applies only when 'Dimension' property is set to 'All'. It calculates the maximum within a particular region of the image. Default : false
vector of y-coordinates of vectices of a rectangle(ROI). Applicable only when 'ROIProcssing' is set to 'true'.
vector of x-coordinates of vectices of a rectangle(ROI). Applicable only when 'ROIProcssing' is set to 'true'.
Stores the index at which the maximum value occurs.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The function calculates the maximum value in a given image matrix.
